item.title: The delicate art of deception: A badminton trick shot and its unlikely inspiration
item.dc:creator: Pritish Raj

media:content.media:title: Step 1: Adopting a backhand stance (racquet parallel to floor) as if to pop shuttle straight, is key; Step 2: With no perceivable change, racquet is dropped perpendicular with backhand grip intact

Step 3: The opposite face of the racquet is used on the dropping shuttle (well below eye level) to flick a forehand; Step 4: The wrist flexes at last second, like twisting a knife, and shuttle travels cross-directionally, wrong-footing the opponent
